Dear Jason Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member is inappropriate with youth at the facility. Staff
member refers to some youth as his "wife" or "girl" and looks
youth up and down in a sexual manner. Staff member has several
instances of inappropriate communication in addition to these
concerns. The facility is aware of the concerns, and they have
gone unaddressed.
Investigation Interviews:
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2024.
Foster Care Worker reported when she saw Youth A on May 14,
2024, Youth A reported concerns of Staff 1 making inappropriate
comments to her and her peers on the unit. Youth A did not report
2

when those comments occurred or what other staff were around. She
reported prior to that disclosure, Youth A reported Staff 1 was getting
too close to her and was in her personal bubble. Youth A made a
comment that Staff 1 would sit or stand too close to her at times and
never reported any touching had occurred. Foster Care Worker
reported she spoke to Staff 2 about the initial concerns of Staff 1
being in Youth A’s personal bubble on April 17, 2024. She reported
Staff 2 stated Staff 1 is a newer staff and is learning how to be
around the female youth. Foster Care Worker reported she has never
seen Staff 1 or his interactions with Youth A or the other youth on the
unit.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the Children’s Advocacy
Center on May 28, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement
and MDHHS Worker 1. Youth A reported she feels safe at the
facility. When asked about Staff 1, Youth A reported that he would
make inappropriate comments to Youth B and Youth C. Youth A
reported she had heard Staff 1 tell Youth C that she was his wife and
asked her what her address was because she was moving. She
reported she had heard Staff 1 ask Youth B, “Where you are going
baddie?”. The major concerning statement she heard was Staff 1
telling Youth C he would “whup” her. Youth A denied Staff 1 saying
anything inappropriate to her but stated overhearing those
statements made her feel uncomfortable. She reported there was a
meeting with Supervisor 1, Staff 1, Staff 3, Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C to discuss the comments Staff 1 was making, and Staff 1 did
not say anything about it. Youth A reported Staff 1 would say
inappropriate statements out in the open where others could hear
him and noted she believed Staff 3 overheard him tell Youth C he
was going to “whup” her. Youth A did not report any concerns of
touching occurring from Staff 1 to other youth and just noted she was
concerned about the way he talked to youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the community library on
June 3, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Staff 1
reported he started working at the facility at the end of March 2024.
He reported he has been working with Supervisor 1 who is coaching
him on working on an all-female unit. Staff 1 read the allegations and
reported they were not true. He reported he used words of
encouragement with Youth C, noting that when she did a good job he
stated “That’s my girl” as a proud moment. He reported he does not
look the youth up and down; he watches the youth because that is
part of his job. Staff 1 reported he has never used the term “baddie”
as he does not know what that means. When asked about the
“whoopin” part he stated that when they were sitting in the
community space, Youth C had asked him if he was going to her
going away party. He reported he stated to Youth C he would bring
the cake and maybe a belt because she needs to be whooped for
3

how bad she has been on the unit. He reported that it was supposed
to be taken as a joke and Supervisor 1 corrected him immediately
about that comment. Staff 1 reported he talked with Supervisor 1
about how that comment could not be said because it could be a
trauma trigger for the youth. He reported he is still learning and
knows it is the wrong thing to say now. Staff 1 reported Youth C got
into fights and youth would turn on staff who held her accountable for
her actions. Staff 1 was asked about his relationship with Youth B,
and he reported Youth B is close with Youth C and has behavior
issues as well. He denied he ever called her his wife and stated that
he redirected her when she asked him questions about his wife. Staff
1 reported he attempted to build rapport with Youth B and noted she
came from where he grew up. He reported he asked her if she was
related to anyone with a certain last name and she stated a guy
rapped her by that last name. Staff 1 reported he was taken aback
for a second as the guy he was thinking of was someone different
and was not aware of her trauma history. He reported he did not
have much interaction with Youth A and noted that he had to block
her from trying to get attention from the male youth unit. Staff 1
reported there was an incident he wanted to mention where Youth C
and Youth D were fighting. He reported he broke up the fight with
Supervisor 2 and was able to get Youth D off the unit away from
Youth C. Staff 1 reported Youth C got upset by that and took off her
shirt and started to charge at him. He reported he put his hands up to
keep space between himself and Youth C. Staff 1 reported Youth C’s
chest did come in contact with his hands and Supervisor 2 got
immediately in between them. He reported Youth C reported she was
going to get him fired. Staff 1 reported he never did anything to cause
harm to the youth and it was his job to protect them. He reported he
is open to learning more to help support youth to be successful in the
future.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 3,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Youth B reported
she hates living at the facility because of the rules especially related
to home passes. She reported there are youth on the unit with unsafe
behavior. When asked to explain, Youth B reported when Youth C
was living in the unit, she would fight everyone for no reason and
would look to get someone in trouble. When asked about Staff 1,
Youth B reported she heard Staff 1 tell Youth C he was going to
“whup” her.” When asked if Staff 1 ever said anything inappropriate
to her, she reported Staff 1 had called her his wife. Youth B reported
staff were never around when Staff 2 would make these comments.
Youth B reported Staff 3 did an intervention with Staff 1 and the
youth because of the reports of concerns Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C said. She reported Staff 1 talked to her about living in the
same town she was from and asked her about knowing someone
who had caused her trauma in the past. Youth C reported she did not
4

want to talk further about that because it is traumatizing and has not
brought up this concern to anyone else. She reported Staff 1 has
never touched anyone inappropriately. Youth C reported there was a
time when Youth C got into a fight and she pushed her body up on
Staff 1, which he then backed away. She reported Staff 1 makes her
feel uncomfortable.
Youth C was attempted to be interviewed on June 5, 2024, and
June 11, 2024. MDHHS Worker 3 attempted to do an announced
home visit on June 5, 2024, and there was no answer. A phone
called was also made and there was no answer. On June 11, 2024,
this consultant attempted to call to interview Youth C but there was
no answer or voicemail that could be left for the contact number
provided by the facility.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
3, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 1 had a hard time building rapport with the youth on
the unit. She reported he was more guarded and had received some
coaching as it pertained to working with female youth in a trauma-
informed way. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 had a lot of issues with
Youth C where she would state that he was awkward and would
stare at her all the time. She asked Youth C why she did not like Staff
1, and she reported that she does not like any male staff. Supervisor
1 explained Youth C has a long sexual abuse history so it was not
surprising that she would make comments about Staff 1. She
reported Youth C stated Staff 1 called her his girl and she processed
with her about this. Supervisor 1 reported she heard Youth C telling
Youth B that she was going to punch Staff 1 and encouraged Youth
B to tell staff that Staff 1 touched her and said inappropriate things.
She reported when she overheard that conversation, she jumped in
to redirect the youth. Supervisor 1 reported when Staff 2 told her
about Youth A’s disclosure that Staff 1 made her feel uncomfortable
on the unit she reported she was present when the incident was
going on. She reported on that day Youth C was trying to get
attention from the all-male unit in the building and had to be
redirected by staff and her behaviors escalated. Youth A is a follower
and wanted to follow Youth C to get attention from the male youth,
but Staff 1 was blocking her from the area, and Youth A reported he
was too close to her when he was doing his job correctly. Supervisor
1 reported there was one incident where she redirected Staff 1 and
provided coaching to him. She reported it was within a group setting
when Youth C asked if she could get a cake for her goodbye party
and Staff 1 responded with you can get cake and a good “whoopin”
too because of your bad behavior. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 was
trying to joke with Youth C about this, but she redirected him about
saying that and provided him coaching on how the comment could be
5

taken when the youth have experienced trauma. She reported he
was responsive to the feedback and willing to grow.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
3, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Supervisor 2
reported she works on the all-male unit but has been called over to
provide support to the female unit. She reported on April 17, 2024,
Youth C had got into a fight with Youth D. Supervisor 2 reported she
was on the unit with Youth C, Youth D, and Staff 1 when this
occurred. Staff1 was to get Youth D off the unit safely after the fight,
but Youth C was still escalated. Youth C took off her shirt and was
wearing a bra and pants. She ran up to Staff 1 and stated that she
was to fight him since he took Youth D off the unit. Supervisor 2
continued to redirect Youth C and Staff 1 outstretched his hands to
maintain space to prevent Youth C from touching him. Staff 1 tried to
redirect her, but she bumped Staff 1’s hand with her chest.
Supervisor 2 immediately intervened by putting her hand up between
Staff 1 and Youth C. She reported Youth C stated she was going to
get Staff 1 fired for sexual harassment. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1
did everything correctly in this situation. She reported she reported
this situation to upper leadership and completed an incident report so
that it was documented that everything was handled appropriately.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 3,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Staff 2 reported he
is the case manager for the youth in this unit. He reported Foster
Care Worker did report to him the concerns of Youth A reporting
feeling uncomfortable with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Foster Care
Worker noted that the issue was when Youth A was down her
hallway and asked Staff 1 to move so she could get past. Staff 1 did
not move over fast enough and Youth A had to squeeze past. He
reported he brought this concern up to Supervisor 1 and was told that
this is being handled on the unit. Staff 2 reported no youth brought up
direct concerns about Staff 1 to him. Staff 2 reported he did work with
Youth C a lot but noted she would gang up on a certain staff when
she did not get her way. He reported she never disclosed concerns
to him directly about Staff 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on June 4, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Staff 3 reported Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C have brought concerns up to her about
comments Staff 1 has made to them. Youth C reported Staff 1 would
make comments saying she was his girl and would stare at her. Staff
3 reported she remembered one incident where Youth C was doing
karaoke with another youth, but could not remember who this youth
was, Staff 1 and Staff 3. She reported she stepped off the unit for a
moment and heard Staff 1 tell Youth C to put her shirt down. When
Staff 3 came onto the unit, Youth C had her shirt rolled up showing
6

her stomach area and teaching the other youth how to dance. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 was doing the appropriate thing with redirecting.
Staff 3 reported Youth A disclosed concerns about Staff 1 being too
close to her and described the day when Youth C was taken off the
unit because of Youth C's violent behavior. Staff 1 was present with
Youth A during this time and Youth A was attempting to get back
onto the unit with Youth C. Staff 3 reported she witnessed Youth A
yell at Staff 1 to get away from her as he attempted to block her from
getting back onto the unit with Youth C. Staff 3 reported Youth A
then yelled at Staff 1 for being her personal space, even though he
was doing his job keeping Youth A safe. She reported Youth B also
reported concerns about Staff 1 calling her his wife. Staff 3 reported
she told these concerns to Supervisor 1 and had a house meeting
with the youth and Staff 1 to address the concerns. She reported it
appeared Youth C did not like Staff 1 and was getting the other youth
to report concerns. When asked how Staff 3 knew this she stated
Youth A reported to her that Youth C told her to report concerns
about Staff 1 to get him fired. Staff 3 reported she had no concerns
with Staff 1’s boundaries with the youth and noted the youth
attempted to touch him at times and he would constantly redirect
them to maintain appropriate boundaries.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on June 4, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Staff 4 reported she only
worked with Staff 1 for a short time. She reported she overheard
Youth B and Youth C talking about Staff 1 and she completed a
check-in with them. Staff 4 reported Youth B and Youth C stated
Staff 1 had made comments about them and would stare at them
which would make them feel uncomfortable. Youth B and Youth C
would not express exactly what the comments were. Staff 4 reported
there was a house meeting about the youth reporting concerns about
Staff 1. She reported it appeared the youth were following the lead of
Youth C and not liking Staff 1 due to him being a male staff. Staff 4
reported she felt this way because when the youth were confronted
about what comments were being made, they would just say they
were joking or heard Youth C talking about it. Staff 4 reported she
never heard Staff 1 make inappropriate comments and she worked
with him three days a week since he started a few months prior.
Law Enforcement was interviewed face to face at the Children’s
Advocacy Center on May 28, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker 1. Law Enforcement reported she will be closing out her
case as Youth A did not report a sexual abuse crime within her
interview.
Documents Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Personnel File- Staff 1 started working at the facility
on March 25, 2024. Prior to being hired, all appropriate
7

background checks including sex offender registry and
criminal history was completed on March 4, 2023, which noted
to be all clear. Staff 1 had completed all required onboarding
training which included Maintaining Professional Boundaries
on March 27, 2024, and Ministry Safe Sexual Abuse
Awareness online course on March 27,2024.
- Incident Report dated April 19, 2024- This incident report
was completed by Supervisor 2 for the incident that occurred
with Youth C and Staff 1 on April 17, 2024. Incident report is
consistent with Supervisor 2’s interview.
- Facility Suitable Treatment and Freedom of Movement
policy dated April 2018- This policy notes that employee’s
responses and involvement with a client should always reflect
what is appropriate. The policy provides examples that staff
should not use obscene language towards a youth, horseplay,
or excessively disclose personal information. Staff should
have a professional relationship with the youth.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews, Staff 1
did not use appropriate language with Youth C when he reported
he was going to bring a belt to her going away party because she
deserved a “whoopin”. Staff 1 reported it was a joke, but the
statement is a violation of the facility’s suitable treatment and
freedom of movement policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000256 dated 4/3/23; CAP approved 4/18/23
SIR 2024C0000932SI dated 12/20/23; CAP approved 1/10/24
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
